title: Form 10-Q Q3 2025
excerpt: These conditions raise substantial doubt about the Company's ability to continue as a going concern within one year after the date these financial statements are issued. The Company was not in compliance with the debt service coverage ratio covenant under its senior secured credit facility as of September 30, 2025.

title: Form 8-K Current Report
excerpt: The Company has entered into discussions with its lenders regarding potential amendments to or waivers of certain covenants under its credit agreement.

title: Apex Retail warns of going concern, seeks lender relief
excerpt: Apex Retail Group Inc said on Wednesday it has 'substantial doubt' about its ability to remain in business, as the struggling department store operator seeks relief from lenders after breaching debt covenants.

title: Retail sector distress deepens as Apex joins troubled list
Northstar Apparel Announces Comprehensive Transformation Plan
excerpt: As part of this transformation, the Company plans to close approximately 150 underperforming locations and has retained Kirkland & Ellis LLP and Lazard to advise on strategic alternatives to strengthen its balance sheet.

title: Northstar taps Kirkland & Ellis as it weighs bankruptcy
excerpt: Northstar Apparel Inc. has hired law firm Kirkland & Ellis LLP as it weighs options including a potential bankruptcy filing, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Apparel retailer Northstar to shutter 150 stores
Form 8-K Current Report
excerpt: The Company's liquidity position has deteriorated significantly. Based on current projections, the Company expects available liquidity to be insufficient to meet obligations beyond the second quarter of 2026.

title: Urban Fitness closes 8 gyms overnight, members locked out
excerpt: Members of Urban Fitness Collective arrived to find doors locked and a handwritten sign citing 'cash flow challenges' at eight locations across Michigan and Texas that closed without warning this week.

title: Fitness chain owes landlords millions after sudden closures
excerpt: At least five landlords have filed lawsuits against Urban Fitness Collective seeking unpaid rent totaling more than $2.3 million. The company reportedly failed to pay January rent at most locations.

title: Southfield Mall LLC v. Urban Fitness Collective
Form 8-K Credit Agreement Amendment
excerpt: The Amendment provides for, among other things, (i) a waiver of the Company's compliance with the Total Leverage Ratio covenant for the fiscal quarter ended September 30, 2025, and (ii) an increase in the applicable margin by 0.75%.

title: Meridian secures breathing room from lenders
Form 8-K Guidance Update
excerpt: The Company is updating its fiscal year 2026 revenue guidance to a range of $350 million to $370 million, down from prior guidance of $440 million to $460 million, reflecting a more challenging demand environment.

title: TechFlow slashes outlook, cuts 15% of staff
Form 8-K Material Contract
excerpt: The Company was notified that Amazon.com Services LLC will not renew the Delivery Service Partner Agreement upon its expiration on June 30, 2026. This contract represented approximately 30% of the Company's consolidated revenues.

title: Continental Logistics tumbles after losing Amazon deal
Form 8-K Legal Proceedings
excerpt: On January 3, 2026, the Company received a subpoena from the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to an investigation of the Company's revenue recognition practices. The Company is cooperating fully with the SEC.

title: Form 8-K Liquidity Update
excerpt: The Company elected to draw the remaining $150 million available under its revolving credit facility to enhance financial flexibility.

title: Sterling Media taps Alvarez & Marsal amid cash crunch
excerpt: Sterling Media Group has retained restructuring firm Alvarez & Marsal to advise on options as the company grapples with declining advertising revenue and rising content costs.

title: In re: James Morrison Chapter 7
Local spa owner files bankruptcy, business future unclear
excerpt: James Morrison, owner of the Harmony Wellness Spa chain, filed for personal Chapter 7 bankruptcy this week, listing debts of more than $1.2 million including personal guarantees on business leases.

title: Form 8-K Earnings Release
excerpt: Q3 2025 revenue of $285 million exceeded guidance of $245-$250 million. The Company is raising its FY26 revenue guidance to $1.15-$1.20 billion from $950 million-$1.0 billion.

title: BlueSky Announces Phoenix Expansion
excerpt: BlueSky Manufacturing today announced plans to expand its Phoenix manufacturing facility by 150,000 square feet to meet growing demand.

title: Form 8-K Debt Refinancing
excerpt: The Company completed the refinancing of its senior secured credit facilities, extending the maturity date to January 2031 and reducing the applicable interest rate margin by 50 basis points.

title: Granite Construction gets credit upgrade after refi
excerpt: S&P Global Ratings upgraded Granite Construction Holdings to BB+ from BB, citing improved liquidity and extended debt maturities following the company's successful refinancing.

title: Redwood Announces FDA Approval of REDX-101
excerpt: Redwood Pharmaceuticals today announced that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has approved REDX-101 for the treatment of advanced non-small cell lung cancer. The Company plans to significantly expand its commercial organization and headquarters operations.

title: Redwood Pharma soars on FDA nod for cancer drug
Quantum Data raises $50M Series C, hits profitability
excerpt: Quantum Data Systems, which provides AI infrastructure for enterprise customers, has raised $50 million in Series C funding led by Sequoia Capital. The company also announced it achieved profitability in Q4 2025.

title: Quantum Data Systems Announces Series C Funding
